files.description: Single-file smoke test runner that captures full stdout/stderr, logs runtime environment and resource stats, implements retries with backoff, and enforces hard escalation when expected execution artifacts are missing.
Reproducible minimal failing case script that can deterministically simulate common failure modes (nonzero exit, timeout, missing artifacts) to validate instrumentation and escalation behavior.
Declarative list of required output artifacts and validation rules used by the smoke test to decide success versus hard escalation when files are missing.
Dockerfile for a minimal, reproducible execution environment that runs the smoke test and produces captured logs and artifacts for debugging container health issues.
Docker Compose configuration to run the smoke test in a controlled container with configurable resource limits, volumes for artifacts, and environment overrides.
Container entrypoint that initializes directories, invokes the smoke test with consistent defaults, and ensures logs/artifacts are persisted to mounted volumes.
Pinned Python dependencies required for resource and environment instrumentation (and consistent behavior across runs).
Documentation describing how to run the container-health smoke test locally and via Docker, interpret logs, configure retries/backoff, and reproduce the minimal failing case.

missionDescription: Add container-health instrumentation and a reproducible minimal failing case: run a single-file smoke test with full stdout/stderr capture; log runtime environment + resource stats; implement retries/backoff and a hard escalation rule when execution artifacts are missing.
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete the urgent task identified by Meta-Coordinator

Curated insight (actionability 8-9/10): Stabilizing the recurring 'container lost' failure is a prerequisite for any rubric-driven QA/review workflow: without reliable execution, you canâ€™t generate the artifacts needed for escalation trigge...
